solution_line_template: First find how many birds get scared away by kids: {initial_seagulls} seagulls / {scared_denominator} = <<{initial_seagulls}/{scared_denominator}={scared_away}>>{scared_away} seagulls
Then subtract that number from the starting total: {initial_seagulls} seagulls - {scared_away} seagulls = <<{initial_seagulls}-{scared_away}={remaining_after_kids}>>{remaining_after_kids} seagulls
Then divide that number by 3: {remaining_after_kids} seagulls / {mcdonalds_denominator} = <<{remaining_after_kids}/{mcdonalds_denominator}={fly_to_mcdonalds}>>{fly_to_mcdonalds} seagulls

Then subtract that number from the 27 seagulls to find the final number of seagulls: {remaining_after_kids} seagulls - {fly_to_mcdonalds} seagulls = <<{remaining_after_kids}-{fly_to_mcdonalds}={seagulls_left}>>{seagulls_left} seagulls
